Copy No. 36( W,P, (44) 629.8th November, 1944.WAR CABINET.COMPULSORY MILITARY SERVICE.Note by the Secretary.AT their meeting^ on the 26th October, 1944* the War Cabinet agreed thatthe question whether some form of compulsory Military service should becontinued after the war should be examined by a Cabinet Committee. The PrimeMinister undertook to give consideration to the membership and terms of reference of the Committee.2. The Prime Minister has now decided that the question should be referredto the Armistice and Post-War Committee, with the following terms ofreference : " To report whether some form of compulsory military service in the armed Forces of the Crown should be continued after the war.'' In its examination the Committee is asked to take into account the size of our post-war forces, so far as that can be foreseen; the resultant man-power requirement; and the political factors involved."(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Offices of the War Cabinet, S. W. 1,8th November, 1944.'W.M. (44) 141st Conclusions, Minute 6.[28558]
